StateMachine
Class StateMachine

java.lang.Object
  StateMachine.StateMachine
Direct Known Subclasses:
threadableMultiQueueStateMachine
public abstract class StateMachine
extends java.lang.Object

Implements a DFA, where the edges are Commands and the vertices are States. Each State and Command can be equipped with a call, that is triggered when the state is entered or the command is executed.

Author:
Sebastian van Wickern

Field Summary
private  State state
           
 
Constructor Summary
StateMachine()
           
StateMachine(State initial)
           
 
Method Summary
 void execute(Command c)
          Executes a Command c on the DFA, meaning that it tries to go from state with c to another State, if that is not possible (because state has no edge for the Command c) it throws a StateException.
 State getState()
          returns a copy of the state the DFA is at right now.
 void setInitialState(State initial)
          This method sets the state to initial, but it does this only once, to insure that the StateMachine cannot be reset, or changed within runtime (which would potentially lead to an undefined state).
 java.lang.String toString()
           
 
Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

StateMachine

public StateMachine(State initial)
Parameters:

StateMachine

public StateMachine()
Method Detail

setInitialState

public final void setInitialState(State initial)
This method sets the state to initial, but it does this only once, to insure that the StateMachine cannot be reset, or changed within runtime (which would potentially lead to an undefined state).

Parameters:
initial - State to start with.

execute

public void execute(Command c)
             throws StateException
Executes a Command c on the DFA, meaning that it tries to go from state with c to another State, if that is not possible (because state has no edge for the Command c) it throws a StateException.

Parameters:
c - the Command to execute on the DFA.
Throws:
StateException - if there is no edge c from state.

getState

public State getState()
returns a copy of the state the DFA is at right now.

Returns:
a copy of the state the DFA is at right now.
